title: Server Issues are ruining my matches
body: So, I'm trying to climb in ranked, and my latest match was a match playing as morgana support, when, during a crucial teamfight, I spike to over 1000 ping and stay like that for the rest of the match, and we lost that match, and before you ask me if it is my internet connection, it is not as I have never experienced anything above 60 ping, have my fps capped at 60 fps and have everything on low quality. But that is not all. The other day, I was in champ select and the client crashed, causing me to lose 3 lp and enjoy the wait of a 5 minute leaverbuster. I'm not one to complain about anything, not even about the trolls or patch changes that I disagree with, but it's starting to get old when I lose lp (and even series in some extreme cases), when I experience bullshit issues like this.{{item:3070}} Is anyone else experiencing this issue?

replies.body:
This might not be helpful, but if you're playing on Wireless, don't.

My wireless connection is great but this game cannot handle Wireless apparently... I get ping spikes from 50-1200 when playing LoL on any Wireless network (tried 4 different networks and 2 different computers, One with a way better network card and same result). Makes it entirely unplayable on Wireless for me. I have consistent 20-40 ms ping on Wired connections, but Wireless is just impossible to deal with.

I am certain the game's programming for 'recovering' from lag spikes is very buggy. Cause whenever I have a lag spike on Wireless it takes way longer than it should to 'return' the game state to normal, meaning usually a guaranteed death depending on when it happened. In some super rare cases, the entire game has frozen from a huge lag spike (over 3s ) to the point where nothing will happen in the game at all until I restart the game. Again, this only happens on Wireless and never on Wired, so it's not too big of a problem, but still kind of annoying that it is impossible for me to play this on wireless.

While Deep Terror Nami's steps are fairly solid, are you still consistently experiencing these issues?  Or were these incredibly isolated issues and haven't experienced them again?

Feel free to reply back and let us know!

Please follow the steps (if there are any you haven't completed) on the [Connection Troubleshooting Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to make sure your connection is set up properly.

You can view your connection by running a traceroute, and sharing the results might show us where it's going wrong. Please download the [WinMTR Network Diagnostic Tool](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/), then use that to run a traceroute to the following IP (allow this to run for 5-15 minutes);

> 104.160.131.1

Please 'copy text to clipboard' and paste it here.
